reviewText: Do not waste your money on any of the Opera World series.  I bought a VHS series of six Gilbert and Sullivan operettas, and I am SO sorry I wasted my money.  I grew up on Gilbert and Sullivan (they were one of my mother's favorites) and these productions are a slap in the face to these two geniuses.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have friends who will kill me for saying this, but this is probably the best Pinafore available on DVD.  It has just the right balance of everything.  It is a romantic comedy that never takes itself seriously, it emphasizes the humor (Dick Deadeye really is "rather triangular"), well sung for the most part, and well performed.  The reason some people may kill me is because some I know were upset by Frankie Howerd's singing, which admittedly was not of true G&S quality, but the overall effect was so good that who can truly find fault.  If you want to see good "Pinafore", this is good a place to start as any, then you be the judge.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed this version of Pinafore a lot, but have some qualms about the casting of Frankie Howerd.  Not a perfect Pinafore, but a very good one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are not familar with Gilbert & Sullivan musicals - they are in a catagory of their own.  Over acted, silly, sexy, great tunes, toung-in-cheek you will hum for days.  There have been many productions of Gilbert & Sullivan with the most famous being the Doily-Carte Opera Company.  I really love them all.  HOWEVER, this version of H.M.S. Pinafore was filmed in many locations, yet still remains true to the authors. It moves fast...has explosions....romance....fighting...and some outstanding numbers - my favorite is the Cops song and dance...you will be tapping your feet.  Once you see this film, you will want more G & S!
summary: Gilbert and Sullivan at its finest
Title: N/A

reviewText: SPARE YOURSELF THIS EXPERIENCE!Much as I adore Gilbert & Sullivan, and could even tolerate The Hollywood Squares quiz show once upon a time, I can't figure out why anyone thought Peter Marshall would be able to contribute to a G&S; production.  And sure enough, he couldn't.In fact, his presence is one of the many downfalls of this production, which include mediocre choreography, a poorly designed set, unconvincing personalities, and some truly bizarre camera work. It's difficult to even sit through this embarrassing production once.  You'll be better off catching a local amateur production.
summary: Living proof that TV personalities don't belong onstage!
Title: N/A
